image.altText: Jacob Vadakkedathu 2025-04-11 10:04:00

props.synopsis: Canberra Liberals Senate candidate Jacob Vadakkedathu says "there will be voluntary redundancies" as part of a plan to cut public service jobs.

title.children: Canberra Liberals candidate says no forced redundancies in public cuts plan

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man is sentenced to nearly seven years jail after pleading guilty to five counts of aggravated rape, one act of indecency and a threat to kill committed against a 14-year-old girl over five days.

title.children: Man jailed for raping 14-year-old, threatening to kill her with machete

image.altText: A man with short black hair sits in a museum in front of a glass artwork depicting cabbage leaves on a wall.

props.synopsis: Blending contemporary artwork with archival material, a new exhibition at the National Museum in Canberra promises to captivate and educate visitors about the little-known history of Aboriginal-Chinese people in Australia.

title.children: New National Museum exhibit 'a celebration' of Aboriginal-Chinese people

image.altText: Commonwealth park floriade

props.synopsis: The decision-makers behind Canberra's Parliamentary Triangle are sharing their ideas for the future of Commonwealth Park, but they want more input.

title.children: More flowers, a lakeside swimming pool and a Ferris wheel on the cards for Commonwealth Park

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: Angus Ross Robertson, 24, was charged with two counts of rape and two acts of indecency on the woman, who was a fellow cadet.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping fellow ADFA cadet

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: The exterior of a modern concrete building with a sign out front reading "High Court of Australia".

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Rodney Cherry loses his High Court bid for freedom, after the court refuses to overturn Queensland's no body no parole law.

title.children: Convicted killer Rodney Cherry loses appeal for freedom

image.altText: A small white fluffy glider with prominent ears, wide eyes and a little button nose peeks out of hole in a tree at night

props.synopsis: The South East Forest Rescue group alleged the Forestry Corporation of NSW did not conduct a broad area habitat search for features of habitat for three species of glider in a northern New South Wales forest.

title.children: High Court verdict provides 'hope amid an escalating extinction crisis'

image.altText: albanese dutton split

props.synopsis: The prime minister alleged he had also been the subject of a serious incident, while the AFP has warned that the overall number of reported threats to politicians has increased.

title.children: Albanese reaches out to Dutton over report of alleged terror plot

image.altText: Joel Amartey walks to the Sydney bench while holding his hamstring

props.synopsis: Collingwood is looking to make it four wins in a row but standing in the way is an in-form Sydney side. Follow live.

title.children: Swans lose key big man to injury as Pies make a move

image.altText: Reece Walsh of the Broncos is tackled

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Broncos will be aiming to beat the Sydney Roosters for the second time in 2025 when they face off at Lang Park. Follow live.

image.altText: Laith Hanna wears a blue jacket, white collared shirt and grey patterned tie and walks outside court.

props.synopsis: A Victorian business has been ordered to pay a $3 million fine over a workplace manslaughter, after the state's highest court increased the penalty on appeal.

title.children: Victorian business ordered to pay $3m fine in work manslaughter case

image.altText: An AI-generated image shows a uniformed Trump, Musk and Vance working on a factory line.

props.synopsis: Chinese social media has exploded with memes mocking the Trump administration's hefty tariffs on the country.

title.children: Chinese social media erupts in memes over Trump’s 145 per cent tariff

image.altText: A crane vessel and rescue vessel in the river

props.synopsis: Officials say the tour aircraft lost control and hit the water upside down near Lower Manhattan. The helicopter tour company's owner said he had "no clue" why the crash happened.

title.children: Family of Spanish tourists killed in New York helicopter crash

image.altText: Composite of pop star Katy Perry wear oragne outfit with white background, left, with Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry, right

props.synopsis: Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry has secured a hearing in the court after earlier losing an appeal over the use of the homophonous name as a trademark by the US singer.

title.children: Katy Perry v Katie Perry trademark saga to be heard by High Court

image.altText: taiwan coast guard stop and detain a cargo ship in the taiwan straight

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say the man was captain of the Chinese-crewed but Togolese-registered ship Hong Tai 58, which is accused of damaging a cable with its anchor.

title.children: Taiwan charges Chinese ship captain with damaging undersea cables

image.altText: Toutai Kefu arrives at the Supreme Court of Queensland in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: An appeal against "manifestly inadequate" sentences given to two teenagers who attacked former Wallaby star Toutai Kefu and his family in their home in 2021 has been heard in the Supreme Court.

title.children: 'Inadequate': Sentence appeal against teens who invaded rugby great's home

image.altText: Viola Davis holds a gun overhead and looks to the camera with a steely expression in front of her car with US flags on it.

props.synopsis: There are movies you'd expect to see Viola Davis star in, and there are those you wouldn't. G20 is the latter.

title.children: Viola Davis wanted action flick G20 to be fun and inspiring. It's anything but

image.altText: Tim Smith wearing a dark suit with a red flower pinned to the collar.

title.children: MAFS contestant detains teen allegedly armed with machete in Prahran

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a dark shirt and jeans stands with his hands in his pockets on an airstrip.

props.synopsis: Tim Jordan welcomes ASIC's decision not to take action against Bonza's directors, but laments the impact the failure of the enterprise has had on customers and staff.

title.children: Bonza boss speaks for first time since collapse as ASIC probe ends

image.altText: Collage of electricity bill behind a green mountain with powerlines on orange background.

props.synopsis: We take a closer look at the average power bill to see which sections Australians should be keeping an eye on or asking questions about.

title.children: Understanding power bills and how consumers are using this to save

image.altText: Ja Morant covers his ears with his hands during a Memphis Grizzlies NBA game.

props.synopsis: Ja Morant has been suspended twice for brandishing real guns and fined for mimicking fake ones, so he has changed his celebrations to an even more explosive mime.

title.children: Fined for his gun mimes, NBA star switches to grenade celebration

image.altText: A photo of the Nickel factory sitting by the coast under blue skies.

props.synopsis: A billion-dollar bet on nickel mining gave many New Caledonians hopes of economic prosperity and political independence. But after the market turned, the mine has left behind a ghost town full of broken hearts.

title.children: 'We are in the s**t': Mine's closure cripples Pacific indigenous community

image.altText: A man with a shadowed face and blonde hair leaves court

props.synopsis: Former South Australian Liberal Party leader David Speirs started using cocaine in June 2024 when it was offered to him by a "third party" to cope with stress, a court has heard.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader used cocaine as 'escapism', court hears

image.altText: A number of officials pose for a picture next to a grey weapon

props.synopsis: The Defence Department told the ABC that “Australia has not supplied weapons or ammunition to Israel” since the Gaza war began in 2023.

title.children: Australian weapon trialled by Israel's military ahead of potential sale

image.altText: A man in black glasses points passed a woman with long brown hair. Two police stand nearby

image.altText: Bailey Smith gives double middle fingers to a fan after the Geelong Cats' win over Adelaide Crows.

title.children: Smith says he 'shouldn't have done the double bird' at Adelaide fan

image.altText: Fossil jawbone as seen from the right.

props.synopsis: An analysis of a jawbone found off the Taiwanese coast reveals it belonged to a Denisovan, a mysterious human species that contributed some genetic material to Indigenous Australians and people living in Asia today.

title.children: Enigmatic extinct cousin of modern humans confirmed in Taiwan

image.altText: A skinny, dark-coated dog wearing a brightly coloured collar.

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier woman has received a suspended prison sentence after admitting to the ill treatment of six dogs in her care.

title.children: Woman avoids jail after dogs found starving in SA home

image.altText: A close-up of Matt Denny as he prepares to throw a discus

props.synopsis: Just days after breaking the 70-metre barrier for the first time, Australia's Matt Denny throws 74.25 metres, just shy of the world record.

title.children: Denny within 10cm of discus world record in stellar week for Australian athletics

image.altText: An aerial view of crops in vast open country.

props.synopsis: A controversial mining project in northern Victoria has been cleared to proceed despite staunch community opposition.

title.children: New mine gets 20-year licence despite fears land will be 'scarred forever'

image.altText: A close-up photo of Jaden with his arm around Kelly, both a smiling

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old Perth man who fatally stabbed a teenager during a botched, phoney drug deal is sentenced to life in prison.

title.children: 'Acting like gangsters': 21yo jailed for murder in fake drug deal
